comment.author: 75702425@N03
comment._content: My Great, Great Grandfather was a member of this company and may very well be in this picture.

comment.author: 26491575@N05
comment._content: Fascinating information, FluffyF4210! I wish those in the photograph were identified so we could know for sure but the photograph didn't come with any additional information. For more information on early Philadelphia firefighters, you may want to reach out to the Fireman's Hall Museum: www.firemanshall.org/home.html

comment.author: 75702425@N03
comment._content:
William Penn Hose Company
Est. February 3, 1830
Location:Public Square, Kensington

William Penn Hose Company motto:
“Like Penn, We will be useful to our country”

The curator at Fireman's Hall is my next stop.  How could I obtain a copy of this photo?

comment.author: 26491575@N05
comment._content: Thanks for the additional information about the company! You can feel free to place an order on our Web site below: www.lcpimages.org/forms/request_form.htm

comment.author: 78996631@N02
comment._content:
My grandfather, Frank Maturo, Sr. was a Philadelphia fireman for many years, as were my uncles, Vito and John Maturo.  Does anyone have any information on them?  I believe Frank Maturo lived in S. Philly back in the 1930's and only moved to the suburbs in the 70's (?).

Joyce Maturo Purvis Carman
Virginia

comment.author: 26491575@N05
comment._content: Hi Joyce, You may want to try the Fireman's Hall Museum I mention in my above comment: www.firemanshall.org/home.html They may be able to point you to available resources. The National Archives has just released the 1940 census so you may find basic information if you know where they lived: 1940census.archives.gov/ I hope these resources help you and please let us know if you need any further assistance!
